general.emptyDescription: No data to display. Try adjusting filters.

modalDownload.title: Your export is ready!
modalDownload.content: Click the Download button to download the exported file.

userGroupWarning.title: User group access
userGroupWarning.content-part-1: The URL you are trying to open belongs to the a user group which you are not part of.
userGroupWarning.content-part-2: Please be aware that the query results may not be the same as in the shared URL, due to different settings and global filters. The URL may not even open properly.
userGroupWarning.details: If required, confirm the user group name with the person who has shared this URL and contact your admin to get an access.

dataset.lastProcessedTitle: Last processed date for current data
dataset.lastProcessedContent: This date represents the latest day of data that was processed and is available to use in the dashboard. The frequency of how often the data is processed and when it is available in the dash can differ depending on the dataset.
dataset.globalFiltersContent: Global filters are applied as default across all data queries in the dashboard. This means that the data displayed in the  Research, Reports & Indexing modules, have those default filters applied automatically. These can be overridden where necessary - please contact us for more information.
dataset.campaignMetadataFiltersContent: These filters are applied on all campaign related data queries in the Campaign module and it's related reports.
dataset.cumulativeMetricsContent: Switch to cumulative metrics - Cumulative metrics capture viewing from the start of the query to the selected interval.

filter.confirmGroupDeleteContent: Are you sure you want to remove this group?

errors.idsExist: Group with those id's already exist
errors.globalDescription: An error occurred. Please try refreshing the page! If the problem persists contact support.
errors.notFoundDescription: We can’t seem to find the page you are looking for.

forecasting.confirmDeleteAlteration: Are you sure you want to delete this alteration?
forecasting.editAlterationMessage: Please click the 'Re-calculate' button to include this alteration in the forecast.
forecasting.filterDescription: Choose your filters and click "+ Apply"
forecasting.confirmDeleteVersion: Are you sure you want to delete this version?
forecasting.exportErrorMessage: The exporting process failed. Please try again. If the problem persists, contact our customer service and we will look into it.
forecasting.outdatedMessage: Please Save to re-calculate the forecast based on changed parameters.
forecasting.recalculatingInProgressDescription: We are preparing the new forecast based on selected parameters. This might take a few minutes.
forecasting.masterSetContent:
You are about to set this forecast version as a Master version.

Confirmation will have impact on the following items:

  • Forecasted capacity numbers
  • Forecasted delivered impressions
  • Forecasted Fill rate
  • Forecasted campaign delivery and the campaign end date

Update will take around 10mins, once confirmed.

Would you like to proceed?
forecasting.deleteAlterationConfirmContent: Are you sure you want to delete this alteration?
forecasting.deleteVersionConfirmContent: Are you sure you want to delete this forecast version?
forecasting.resetContent: Changes you made to the version so far will not be saved.
forecasting.saveContent:
Applying new parameters and alterations to the forecast will take couple of minutes.

Would you like to proceed?
forecasting.newVersionWarning: You have pending changes which will be lost if you proceed to create a new forecast version.
forecasting.setMasterWarning: You have pending changes which will be automatically saved if you proceed.
forecasting.leaveContent: Changes you made to the version so far will not be saved.

campaigns.emptyMessage: No results to display. Please adjust your filters to get more results.
campaigns.manageColumnsDescription: Toggle campaign attributes and sort them via drag and drop
campaigns.name: Name

apps.noConfig: There is no config for such application

research.enableAvg: Enable / disable averages for each series
research.enableTrend: Enable / disable trend for each series
research.addMetricsSubtitle: Add and order metrics in table
research.durationSubtitle: Format duration metrics to minutes or hours
research.selectMetricsSubtitle: Select Metrics that you want to appear in the table. Drag & Drop to change the order in which the metrics appear in the table.
research.dataLabelsSubtitle: Show data labels on data points
research.empty: Select what you want to <bold>compare</bold>, chose a <bold>date range</bold>, add optional <bold>filters</bold> and click the <bold>Submit</bold> button
research.filtersTitle: We are not able to show data for the selected filters.
research.filtersSubTitle: Please try refreshing the page or choose different filters.
research.aggregationTitle: To comply with privacy rules, audiences with reach less than <bold>{{number}}</bold> cannot be calculated. For more information please contact your administrator.
research.aggregationSubTitle: Please try increasing the audience size of this query.
research.otherSubtitle: 'We are looking into this and will make it available as soon as possible
research.confirmBookmarkDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this bookmark?

table.moreResults: There are {{numberOfValuesWithZero}} more results of which metrics are 0. <clickable>Click</clickable> to display all the results.

modalExport.title: Your export has started
modalExport.subtitle: The exporting process has successfully started. The file may take some time to generate. You will be able to download it when it's done.

research.title: Research
research.subtitle: Filter and drill down into data

reach.title: Subscriber #
reach.message: The total number of Subscriber IDs viewing. Capping and zapping methodology for validating viewing sessions can be found in the help section in the top right menu in the dashboard.

reachPercent.title: Subscriber %
reachPercent.message: The total number of Subscriber IDs viewing, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

rating.title: Rating
rating.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment.

ratingPercent.title: Rating %
ratingPercent.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

averageDuration.title: Average Duration
averageDuration.message:
The average viewing duration per reached viewer.

The average duration is calculated based on the selected interval of the query which can be: Minute, Hour, Day, Total etc.

Example: If i select the Week interval my average duration will be an average duration per week.

READ MORE

avgDurAll.title: Average Duration All
avgDurAll.message: The average viewing duration across all Viewers.

share.title: Share
share.message: Viewing duration as a percentage of all viewing.

ireach.title: Incremental Reach #
ireach.message: Unique number of households that have viewed a specified time period of a given channel in a specific interval but they havent watched in a previous interval.

osn-reach.title: Reach #
osn-reach.message: The total number of Subscriber IDs viewing.

osn-reachPercent.title: Reach %
osn-reachPercent.message: The total number of Subscriber IDs viewing, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

osn-dreach.title: Device reach #
osn-dreach.message: Number of unique devices that were used by users to view a specified time period (>0 sec) of a given channel over another, broader specified time period.

osn-ratingPercent.title: GRP %
osn-ratingPercent.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

osn-avgDurAll.title: ATS
osn-avgDurAll.message: The average viewing duration across the total universe or target audience.

croatia-reach.title: Reach
croatia-reach.message: The total number of Viewers viewing. Capping and zapping methodology for validating viewing sessions can be found in the help section in the top right menu in the dashboard.

croatia-reachPercent.title: Reach %
croatia-reachPercent.message: The total number of Viewers viewing, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

slovenia-reach.title: Reach
slovenia-reach.message: The total number of Viewers viewing. Capping and zapping methodology for validating viewing sessions can be found in the help section in the top right menu in the dashboard.

slovenia-reachPercent.title: Reach %
slovenia-reachPercent.message: The total number of Viewers viewing, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

uk-reach.title: Reach
uk-reach.message: The total number of Viewers viewing. Capping and zapping methodology for validating viewing sessions can be found in the help section in the top right menu in the dashboard.

uk-reachPercent.title: Reach %
uk-reachPercent.message: The total number of Viewers viewing, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

uksky-reach.title: Reach
uksky-reach.message: The total number of Viewers viewing. Capping and zapping methodology for validating viewing sessions can be found in the help section in the top right menu in the dashboard.

uksky-reachPercent.title: Reach %
uksky-reachPercent.message: The total number of Viewers viewing, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

croatia-rating.title: Rating
croatia-rating.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment.

croatia-ratingPercent.title: Rating %
croatia-ratingPercent.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

slovenia-rating.title: Rating
slovenia-rating.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment.

slovenia-ratingPercent.title: Rating %
slovenia-ratingPercent.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

uk-rating.title: Rating
uk-rating.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment.

uk-ratingPercent.title: Rating %
uk-ratingPercent.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

uksky-rating.title: Rating
uksky-rating.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment.

uksky-ratingPercent.title: Rating %
uksky-ratingPercent.message: The average number of Subscriber IDs viewing at any given moment, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

sky_media-impression.title: Impression #
sky_media-impression.message: The number of impressions served by FreeWheel.

sky_media-impressionPercent.title: Impression %
sky_media-impressionPercent.message: The number of impressions served, as a percentage of the total number of impressions served by FreeWheel.

sky_media-moc.title: Missed Opportunities
sky_media-moc.message: The total number of impressions which were available and have not been filled.

sky_media-pc.title: Total Inventory
sky_media-pc.message: Total number of opportunities that are available to be served.

sky_media-fillRate.title: Fill Rate %
sky_media-fillRate.message: The number of Freewheel impressions served, as a percentage of total inventory.

sky_media-reach.title: Reach
sky_media-reach.message: The number of unique users (All Sky platforms use Sky’s CustomerVisitorID , Opted out customers and non-sky platforms use FreeWheel’s UniqueIdentiferID).

sky_media-frequency.title: Frequency
sky_media-frequency.message: The average number of impressions viewed per unique user.

sky_media-rch_factor.title: Reach Factor
sky_media-rch_factor.message: The factor by which each unique user is scaled, to account for impressions with no unique user ID.

sky_media-revenue_g.title: Gross Value
sky_media-revenue_g.message: The total gross value calculated by multiplying the FreeWheel served impressions by the eCPM across any dimension.

sky_media-ecpm_g.title: ECPM
sky_media-ecpm_g.message: The effective CPM calculated by taking the average Gross CPM from all campaigns within the chosen dimensions.

canalplus-reach.title: Reach #
canalplus-reach.message: The total number of Subscriber IDs viewing. Capping and zapping methodology for validating viewing sessions can be found in the help section in the top right menu in the dashboard.

canalplus-reachPercent.title: Reach %
canalplus-reachPercent.message: The total number of Subscriber IDs viewing, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

canalplus-dreach.title: Device Reach
canalplus-dreach.message: Number of unique devices that were used by users to view a specified time period (>0 sec) of a given channel over another, broader specified time period.

canalplus-rating.title: Rating
canalplus-rating.message:
The Rating metric counts the average number of users that were watching each second.

This is calculated by taking Total Duration and dividing it by the selected time period of the query.

For example, if you have a Total Duration of 24000 hours and time period of 1 day (24 hours), then the Rating would be 1000. (24000/24)

canalplus-ratingPercent.title: Rating %
canalplus-ratingPercent.message:
The Rating Percent metric takes the Rating value and shows it as a percentage of the Universe value for that query.

If the query also uses a Target Audience, then the size of this audience will be used instead of the Universe.

canalplus-share.title: Share
canalplus-share.message:
Viewing duration in the chosen period as a percentage of all viewing in the period.

Share takes the Total Duration value for each item and divides it by Total Duration value in row "All".

For example, if one channel has 1000 hours Total Duration, and the "All" row has 10000 hours, then the share for that channel will be 10%.

canalplus-shareOnContent.title: Content Share
canalplus-shareOnContent.message:
Content Share of each content is total duration for the content divided by the total duration of all viewing in the airtime of the content.


Content Share is only available for Live content (filter by Live Mode), and is only calculated at an Emission level (select Content interval from the interval picker).

READ MORE

canalplus-ratingOnContent.title: Content Rating
canalplus-ratingOnContent.message:
Content Rating is calculated as: Total duration / duration of content


Content Rating is only available for Linear content (excluding On Demand content), and is only calculated at an Emission level (select Content interval from the interval picker).

READ MORE

canalplus-freq.title: Frequency
canalplus-freq.message:
Frequency is calculated as Views / Reach

READ MORE

canalplus-stream.title: Views
canalplus-stream.message:
Views count the number of sessions.

READ MORE

proximus-reach.title: Device Reach #
proximus-reach.message: The total number of Devices viewing. Capping and zapping methodology for validating viewing sessions can be found in the help section in the top right menu in the dashboard.

proximus-reachPercent.title: Device Reach %
proximus-reachPercent.message: The total number of Devices viewing, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

proximus-rating.title: Rating
proximus-rating.message: The average number of Device viewing at any given moment.

proximus-ratingPercent.title: Rating %
proximus-ratingPercent.message: The average number of Device viewing at any given moment, as a percentage of the total universe or target audience.

proximus-averageDuration.title: Average Duration
proximus-averageDuration.message: The average viewing duration per reached Device.

proximus-avgDurAll.title: Average Duration All
proximus-avgDurAll.message:
The average viewing duration across all Devices.

The average duration is calculated based on the selected interval of the query which can be: Minute, Hour, Day, Total etc.

Example: If i select the Week interval my average duration will be an average duration per week.

READ MORE

proximusfw-impression.title: Impression #
proximusfw-impression.message: The number of impressions served by FreeWheel.

proximusfw-impressionPercent.title: Impression %
proximusfw-impressionPercent.message: The number of impressions served, as a percentage of the total number of impressions served by FreeWheel.

proximusfw-mot.title: Missed Opportunities
proximusfw-mot.message: The total number of impressions which were available and have not been filled.

proximusfw-pt.title: Capacity
proximusfw-pt.message: Total number of opportunities that are available to be served.

proximusfw-fillRate.title: Fill Rate %
proximusfw-fillRate.message: The number of Freewheel impressions served, as a percentage of total inventory.

proximusfw-reach.title: Reach
proximusfw-reach.message: The total number of unique subscriber IDs viewing.

proximusfw-frequency.title: Frequency
proximusfw-frequency.message: The average number of impressions viewed per unique subscriber.

proximusfw-rch_factor.title: Reach Factor
proximusfw-rch_factor.message: The factor by which each unique user is scaled, to account for impressions with no unique subscriber ID.

proximusfw-revenue_g.title: Revenue
proximusfw-revenue_g.message: The total revenue (gross value) calculated by multiplying the FreeWheel served impressions by the Advertiser CPM across any dimension.

proximusfw-ecpm_g.title: Advertiser CPM
proximusfw-ecpm_g.message: The Advertiser CPM is effective CPM calculated by taking the average Advertiser CPM from all campaigns within the chosen dimensions.

proximusfw-moleftadt.title: Drop-Off
proximusfw-moleftadt.message: This occurs when a user stops watching and closes the stream partway through a break. These opportunities will not be counted towards Unserved Inventory.

proximusfw-monoadt.title: Missed opportunities
proximusfw-monoadt.message: The total number of impressions which were available and have not been filled. These opportunities make up Unserved Inventory.

advancedSearch.title: Advanced Search
advancedSearch.message:
Multi string and partial matching:
ex.: “breaking s01” would match “Breaking Bad S01E04”

“Starts with” matching (using ^ symbol):
ex.: “^breaking” would match “Breaking Bad S01E04” or any value that starts with that search string.

Please note that the search string is NOT case sensitive and ignores diacritics.

resetStuckExportsButton.message: Set Failed status on exports that have a status In Progress or Waiting. This is used when exporter gets stuck because some exports fail to finalise.

campaignLate.title: Campaign started late!
campaignLate.message: The create date of the campaign was less than 3 business days before the campaign start date.

emission.title: Content
emission.message: This interval will breakdown content by individual airings. The same content can have many airings which are marked by airtime

campaign_label.title: Campaign
campaign_label.message: The campaign ID and campaign name taken from FreeWheel.

sky_media-campaign_budget.title: Budget
sky_media-campaign_budget.message: The gross booked budget allocated to the campaign taken from Landmark.

sky_media-campaign_cpm.title: CPM
sky_media-campaign_cpm.message: The gross CPM of the campaign taken from Landmark.

sky_media-campaign_reach.title: Reach
sky_media-campaign_reach.message: The number of unique users (All Sky platforms use Sky’s CustomerVisitorID , Opted out customers and non-sky platforms use FreeWheel’s UniqueIdentiferID).

sky_media-campaign_frequency.title: Frequency
sky_media-campaign_frequency.message: The average number of impressions viewed per unique user.

sky_media-campaign_servedImpressions.title: Served Impressions
sky_media-campaign_servedImpressions.message: The average number of impressions viewed per unique user.

sky_media-campaign_targetImpressions.title: Target Impressions
sky_media-campaign_targetImpressions.message: The total number of impressions allocated to the campaign taken from FreeWheel.

sky_media-campaign_elapsedTimePercentage.title: Elapsed Time
sky_media-campaign_elapsedTimePercentage.message: % of elapsed time between Start and End date

sky_media-campaign_progressPercentage.title: Progress % / Delivered %
sky_media-campaign_progressPercentage.message: Total delivered impressions for a active campaign expressed as a percentage using Served Impressions / Target Impressions.

sky_media-campaign_osi.title: OSI
sky_media-campaign_osi.message: On Schedule Indicator indicates whether your campaign is on schedule.

sky_media-campaign_ffdr.title: FFDR
sky_media-campaign_ffdr.message: A measure of how much budget the campaign is expected to deliver by the end of its dates. It is expressed as a percentage of its booked budget.

sky_media-campaign_campaign.exinv.title: Excess Inventory
sky_media-campaign_campaign.exinv.message: Excess Inventory taken from the FreeWheel API expressed as a percentage. This ensure a campaign paces ahead of its pacing curve.

sky_media-campaign_createDate.title: Create Date
sky_media-campaign_createDate.message: The date the campaign was created within Landmark.

lastProcessedDate.title: Last processed date for current data
lastProcessedDate.message: This date represents the latest day of data that was processed and is available to use in the dashboard. The frequency of how often the data is processed and when it is available in the dash can differ depending on the dataset.

globalFilters.title: Global filters
globalFilters.message: Global filters are applied as default across all data queries in the dashboard. This means that the data displayed in the  Research, Reports & Indexing modules, have those default filters applied automatically. These can be overridden where necessary - please contact us for more information.

campaignMetadataFilters.title: Campaign metadata filters
campaignMetadataFilters.message: These filters are applied on all campaign related data queries in the Campaign module and it's related reports.

cumulativeMetrics.title: Cumulative metrics
cumulativeMetrics.message: Switch to cumulative metrics - Cumulative metrics capture viewing from the start of the query to the selected interval.

historicalDimension.message: This dimension is based on historical metadata, and will filter only subscribers that had this meta value in the given time range, regardless of viewing behavior.

intervals.message: This interval will breakdown content by individual airings. The same content can have many airings which are marked by airtime

forecasted_impressions.title: Forecasted Impressions
forecasted_impressions.message: A moving estimate of the expected impressions to be delivered for the campaign

forecasted_completion.title: Forecasted Completion Date
forecasted_completion.message: A moving estimate of the expected completion date for the campaign
